website_summaries.verdict: Still far and away the most powerful, and now the easiest-to-use, worksheet app. Except for a few scientific and financial-analysis tasks, it's the first and only choice for manipulating numeric data.
pros: Automated suggestions for creating charts, totals, and pivot tables make pivot tables easier beginners
New FlashFill feature saves manual labor by creating columns of data on the basis of examples you type in
cons: Not the best tool for advanced statistical analysis (use the R language instead)
A few remaining inelegancies, such as the inability to see linked cells on other pages without closing the current page

customer_reviews.title: No standalone installer available and must sign into Microsoft to use
customer_reviews.text: The delivery method for installing this software is far too restrictive. I expected to be able to download an ISO or EXE file, and enter a product key (like most software). I planned to do this at a later date on another computer than the one I ordered from. Not only do you not get a standalone installer, but you must sign in to a Microsoft Account to even proceed installing. I have not even installed this product yet or activated any product key (not provided by the way), yet I am unable to get a refund of this purchase. This was $99 wasted as this will now go unused. I will now be ordering Excel 2010 on disc.
customer_reviews.author: ADAM C. Group

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, Microsoft policies suck
customer_reviews.text: I don't like it as much as previous excel versions, but it works pretty much the way you expect. I'm docking one star for not selling the installation media with the device, you can't even save the downloaded installer! This is an awful way to distribute products, but par for the course for a company like Microsoft. Unless you have some crazy macros, I'd really suggest LibreOffice which can handle excel files just fine. Plus, it's FREE. I install it on all my client's computers by default, there's rarely a compelling reason to buy any Microsoft Office product.
customer_reviews.author: mrjames

customer_reviews.title: Very difficult to get Microsoft Excel 2013 downloaded. After ...
customer_reviews.text: Very difficult to get Microsoft Excel 2013 downloaded. After much frustration I finally went to the Microsoft website and finally got help from a person in the Philippines who worked for Microsoft. This should be a much easier process.
customer_reviews.author: Robert L. Gates

customer_reviews.title: Opaque, miserable, non-functional download procedure.
customer_reviews.text: Unable to download product. Advice on Microsoft site is useless and the public forums are full of similar download failure complaints. I purchased this for a specific situation at work and we have given up trying to get this installed. The one really good bit of MS Office, which I was willing to pay money for, has just lost another customer. Try OpenOffice, it's free and functional.
customer_reviews.author: RichT

customer_reviews.title: Has to be on Internet to work
customer_reviews.text: Amazon sells this as a download no refund so beware. Mine requires internet hookup after install and I was installing on a computer that's not online. also the download is very complicated. too many verifications, so many software companies are so worried about theft it ruins the whole experience of using the software.
customer_reviews.author: William Brown

customer_reviews.title: It's a bad deal.
customer_reviews.text: It's the classic Windows Catch 22. You pay your $99, install, and everything appears to working, except, Windows 8.1 will not accept their product key supplied in the box. You follow the prompts. The prompt says call a Windows representative, however, when calling, the wait time is 90 minutes and I have been disconnected three times. So I'm stuck with 2 hours spent and many more to go. It's a bad deal.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Redden

customer_reviews.title: TOTALLY a waste of time & $$
customer_reviews.text: 80 bucks down the drain. Can't open ANY excel files. Says it's downloaded but I can't find excel anywhere on my computer (wind. 8.1). If I have to be in the cloud to use it, then that should be made clear BEFORE buying and I don't even know if that's the problem. TOTALLY a waste of time & $$.
customer_reviews.author: LB Gschwandtner

customer_reviews.title: Too complicated
customer_reviews.text: Too many bells and whistles on screen. Whatever happened to the earlier Excel I knew so well? The only reason I bought this was I needed Excel on a new PC-- and of course, I could not get it "off" the old PC, even though it worked fine over there.
customer_reviews.author: Greggg

customer_reviews.title: If you liked Excel 2007
customer_reviews.text: If you liked Excel 2007, and 10, you should likely love 13. It is just as robust, adds a few little bells and whistles, and if you really want a detailed analysis of the new things in 2013, this is a really helpful link, in my opinion: [...] It's on the office website, and discusses what's new in Excel 2013.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Those that don't have or can't afford Office 2013 ProPlus
customer_reviews.text: I have the Home Office and Student Edition. Down loaded from my Amazon account, but before you need an [...]account. After that go to Amazon.com and go to "Your Account" (Hover) -> "Your Games & Software Library" and follow the instructions. After software is installed go to Options -> Add-in->COM add-in and check Microsoft Office PowerPivot for Excel 2013, also Power View and Microsoft Maps for Excel to learn Power BI, but Power Query is not there.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: It's Microsoft Excel
customer_reviews.text: Pro: It's still Microsoft Excel, it just looks a little different. Con: Skydrive and having to have online access to verify the license. The price should come down for a single license also, this to much for just one Office program
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: It is required for submission to Amazon, but it ...
customer_reviews.text: It is required for submission to Amazon, but it has changed so much that you can expect a stiff learning curve for no added value. It is also expensive. We will continue to use Libre Office on most of our computers.
customer_reviews.author: J. Bloomer

customer_reviews.title: Comments on the Use and efficiency of Excel2013
customer_reviews.text: If I could have purchased Excel '97 I would have done so. The program was well thought out and fairly easy to navigate to accomplish all that one needed to do. The 2013 version accomplishes the same but one has to hunt more for all the categories needed to achieve your goals of using a spread sheet. Progress ?=not so sure.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew LaScola

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to install with other Office 2010 apps
customer_reviews.text: I have been on customer support calls for a total of 2hrs. What is the point of offering a standalone Excel app when you can't run in congress with Word 2010? Finally gave up and will get the Office 2013 Suite. No refund, no install. I am just going to have to eat the $110 for the standalone Excel 2013.
customer_reviews.author: Rory Richardson

customer_reviews.title: This is just what I needed for a computer that ...
customer_reviews.text: This is just what I needed for a computer that only needed Excel and none of the other office programs. No surprises, works as it should.
customer_reviews.author: Clayborn Lab

customer_reviews.title: Total scam and waste of money Basically
customer_reviews.text: Save your money. First.. Excel comes standard when you buy office! Also, there are all new versions of Office, Excel, etc. They are now going to a monthly plan depending on how many users it ranges from $6.99 to $9.99 a month. Also, you can buy the disc version, but it cost more and you get no support unless you pay for it. Also, after 3 days, my Excel is now crashing and self repair will not work. Total scam and waste of money Basically, don't do what I did.. I just bought excel, and now have to go back and buy office, when excel comes standard with office.
customer_reviews.author: Sparky

customer_reviews.title: A worthwhile upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Great upgrade - the best single feature is ability to have multiple workbooks open simultaneously
customer_reviews.author: Michael W. Feinberg

customer_reviews.title: No more issues with Excel!
customer_reviews.text: This version of Excel eliminated all of the problems I was having with the previous version of the Excel application.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Weinhold

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: If you absolutely _require_ Excel, then yeah, buy this. Otherwise, just use OpenOffice or LibreOffice for free.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Theodoropoulos

customer_reviews.title: Good product annoying download
customer_reviews.text: have always loved excel! Number one issue was trying to get the download to work on my computer. Ended up having to turn off my firewall temporarily
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Installation nightmare.
customer_reviews.text: The product is excellent. However, installing the product through Amazon and then Microsoft was confusing and time consuming. Ended up getting charged twice and finally had to work by phone with Microsoft to install the program and get one charge reversed.
customer_reviews.author: Drake Tummel

customer_reviews.title: Slow
customer_reviews.text: I love having excel again, way better than works. But I have a new computer and this program runs so slow that it is almost useless!
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Clancy

customer_reviews.title: Microsfot Excel 2013
customer_reviews.text: The program is preforming to all of my expectations and is easy to figure out. I enjoy using it to maintain my spread sheets.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Excel 2013 Key Card would not load
customer_reviews.text: I had loaded Microsoft Word 2013 Key Card previously. Excel would not load and stated it was because I already had Microsoft Office when, in fact, all I had loaded was Microsoft Word. I am disenchanted with Microsoft in general because of this kind of baloney.
customer_reviews.author: Richard J. Harp

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Needed PowerPivot in Excel on a PC without all of Office. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Samanthuel

customer_reviews.title: Great!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this program. It keeps all my records at one place, in order and even calculates. Just like having a secretary in my computer.
customer_reviews.author: Sue C. Barron

customer_reviews.title: Installs but crashes before you can open a worksheet. ...
customer_reviews.text: Installs but crashes before you can open a worksheet. Microsoft wants you to buy an additional support package to troubleshoot.
customer_reviews.author: D Lay

customer_reviews.title: Amazon did just fine, Microsoft forces you to have an account with them to use the software you already purchased.
customer_reviews.text: It should be disclosed that you have to have a microsoft account to use this, buying it alone will not allow you to use it. Beside that everything from Amazon worked just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Michael B Curtis

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: for a stand alone computer with no internet access the product is worthless
customer_reviews.author: S Johannes

customer_reviews.title: Not what I needed
customer_reviews.text: This was the wrong software for my machine. Fast refund service, got Excel 2010 and it works great on my machine
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Barber

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work on my Windows 7
customer_reviews.text: Spent a couple hours trying to install. Good luck getting support from MS. They make it impossible to get help. Amazon will not refund so beware. I just wasted $120. Try to find 2010 if you can.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good I needed Word as well. Do you offer word with this?
customer_reviews.author: Tyrone Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Quite an improvement over prior editions, which were quite acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory D. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: expensive
customer_reviews.text: Another software program we use requires Excel, so we had to buy it. It has become a little more user friendly from what I remember in school..but the price isn't friendly.
customer_reviews.author: n ga

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: sometimes it works and sometimes I cant download or copy
customer_reviews.author: Luella E Wood

customer_reviews.title: Microsoft Excel
customer_reviews.text: If you just want Excel as a stand alone program or if you want to upgrade your current version this is the way to go. Install was seamless and it worked great.
customer_reviews.author: R. Grau

customer_reviews.title: I give all the Excel add-ins 5 stars...
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for the Power Pivot add-in...which is a game changer. Power View, Power Map, Power Query, DAX Studio, Data Mining add-in, Predixion Analytics. Buy Excel 2013...then install these free add-ins and build your career.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Happy as a clam
customer_reviews.text: The product arrived on-time and was as stated. No issues with the order or the product!
customer_reviews.author: Jayesh

customer_reviews.title: Yea, Microsoft. Go go go.
customer_reviews.text: Microsoft deserves all the success they have had with all their products. You can depend on them to take care of the customer, also. Love that company!
customer_reviews.author: Anna B

customer_reviews.title: Excel downloaded a virus to me...
customer_reviews.text: When I downloaded all of the updates from the "Cloud" my Norton Internet Security antivirus program blocked a "graph.exe" file which had morphed from another file known as "suspicious.cloud.5" which in fact turned out to be a trojan. I've uninstalled the corrupt software and by no surprise have been unsuccessful at getting tech support or a refund. I think this is the end of my shopping on Amazon and digital downloads. By the way, I installed Microsoft Office Home edition from 2010 and it still works fantastic. New isn't always better.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Works for Me
customer_reviews.text: Have used Excel for years and find it to be the best spreadsheet software for me. Works well, installed easily.
customer_reviews.author: Geoworker

customer_reviews.title: Too had to download, have to go through microsoft and wait to the product codes. Don't bother, you have to sign into the micosof
customer_reviews.text: Too had to download, have to go through microsoft and wait to the product codes. Don't bother, you have to sign into the micosof
customer_reviews.author: Drew Canale

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy your software through Amazon
customer_reviews.text: The process of obtaining this through Amazon was absolutely worthless. I've had nothing but difficulties with activating the software. Next time I'll go directly to Microsoft.
customer_reviews.author: E. W. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Great Product & After Sales Service
customer_reviews.text: I was happy both with the product and the excellent customer support service. I had some issues with the key which were solved promptly and efficiently. I would buy again from Tech for Less because of the great after sales service
customer_reviews.author: Nandini Sarkar

customer_reviews.title: Be warned that the "download" process is hellish! They ...
customer_reviews.text: Be warned that the "download" process is hellish! They want me to Prove my age by "Putting in another credit card number" How does that prove my age???? Once I do, website freezes and the screen becomes blank. DON'T do it!. I wish someone had warned ME! 45 minutes and counting.......no download
customer_reviews.author: Kellie L. Wood

customer_reviews.title: This is a great improvement
customer_reviews.text: I really like a lot of the new features in Excel 2013. There are some really nice chart upgrades, which is sweet because I do that a lot for the business where I work. Flash fill is exciting to preview, but I only occasionally have found a use for it, but for someone who has to build a lot of lists of names it would be a God send. I highly recommend you try Excel 2013.
customer_reviews.author: J. Knapp

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: I can not get to down load can't get help
customer_reviews.author: terry jones

customer_reviews.title: BUYER BEWARE! You have to buy Microsoft Office 365 ...
customer_reviews.text: BUYER BEWARE! You have to buy Microsoft Office 365 to install this. It is not a true stand alone product.

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Do not order this program gave my computer a virus cost me 150.00 to fix it.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria L Simpson

product_meta.title: Microsoft Excel 2013 Key Card (1PC/1User)
product_meta.description:
Platform:PC Key CardThe new Excel gives you intuitive ways to explore your data. In one click, discover new ways to visualize your data, and see your information in new depths.

How do I get my Office software?
Please note: This item does not contain a disc; it is a product key card that requires a download from office.com. See steps involved below:


 1. Once you have placed your order and received your product key card in the mail, locate your product key on the backside of the included card.
 2. When you locate the product key, follow the instructions on the card, and go to https://officesetup.getmicrosoftkey.com/ to download and install.
 3. Enter your 25-digital product key as prompted.
 4. Sign in or create a Microsoft account.
 5. Select your preferred country and language.
 6. From your "My Account" page with Microsoft, select the item that you want to install.
 7. Click the "Install" button to begin your download.
feature_bullets: Licensed for one user for install on one PC. Box includes one Product Key Card - No Disc

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.6 out of 5 stars91 ratings3.6 out of 5 stars
